channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Super Typhoon Ragasa Hits the Philippines, Headed for Hong Kong
item.description: Thousands were evacuated and hundreds of flights have been canceled ahead of the major storm, equivalent in wind speed to a Category 5 hurricane.

item.title: Trump Appointees Roll Back Enforcement of Fair Housing Laws
item.description: Interviews and internal documents show that signature civil rights protections in housing are being dismissed as ideologically driven and D.E.I. in di...

item.title: U.S. lawmakers call for more military dialogue with China as premier Li Qiang welcomes ‘icebreaking trip’
item.description: "I’m deeply concerned that our two militaries don’t communicate more," said Rep. Adam Smith, who led the Congressional delegation to China.

item.title: Amazon sustainability chief & top scientist: AI could end up being climate’s most powerful tool
item.description: At Amazon, we processed 15 billion carbon-related data points in 2024 alone. AI is the force multiplier that sustainability efforts have desperately n...

item.title: How Sarah de Lagarde, who lost two limbs in a train accident, is using AI to develop accessible new tech—including her “kick-ass robot arm”

item.title: As U.N. General Assembly Gathers, Here’s What to Watch For

item.title: 4 Takeaways From the Charlie Kirk Memorial
item.description: High-profile conservative speakers, including President Trump, addressed a packed stadium in Arizona. Erika Kirk forgave her husband’s killer.

item.title: Cyberattack Forces Brussels Airport to Cancel More Flights
item.description: Delays and cancellations, which snarled traffic at major European travel hubs over the weekend, continued into a fourth day.
